Description: Your email address and phone number are collected to create a GOV.UK One Login. If you choose to receive authentication codes via text message, your phone number will be collected.

Online identifiers like your Internet Protocol (IP) addresses, technical information about the device you use such as the model, web browser operating system and unique device ID are collected.
If you prove your identity using the GOV.UK Identity Check app, a likeness check will involve processing your facial biometric data.

If you give your consent, Google Analytics is used to collect information about how you use GOV.UK One Login. This includes information about the pages you use, how long you spend on each page, how you got to GOV.UK One Login, and what you click on while you use the service.
Firebase Crashlytics is used to collect information about problems you may experience when you use the GOV.UK ID Check app, such as the app crashing.

When you make a purchase on LinkedIn, they collect certain information about you, such as your name, address, and payment information.
LinkedIn collects financial information from you when you use services that require payment. This could include your credit card number, billing address, and other payment information.

LinkedIn collects information about your location when you use their services. This could be precise (like when you allow the app to access your device's GPS) or more general (like when you connect to the site from a specific IP address).
LinkedIn collects contact information when you create an account or update your profile. This could include your email address, phone number, and physical address.
If you choose to sync your contacts with LinkedIn, they collect information from your address book.

LinkedIn collects the content you create, share, or post in using their services. This could include the information you put in your profile, the posts you make, the messages you send, and the photos and videos you upload.
LinkedIn collects information about your search history when you use their services. This includes the searches you perform and the pages you visit.
LinkedIn collects identifiers like your IP address, LinkedIn or device ID, cookies and similar technologies.

LinkedIn collects data about how you use their services. This could include the pages you view, the number of bytes transferred, the links you click, the materials you access, the date and time you access the site, the website from which you linked to their site, and other actions you take within the site.

LinkedIn may collect sensitive information if you choose to provide it. This could include information about your race or ethnicity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, political opinions, or health.
LinkedIn collects data from your device about the performance of their services. This could include information about your device, your network, your IP address, and error reports.

LinkedIn may collect other information based on your use of their services. This could include information about your participation in polls, surveys, or promotional offers, or information you provide when you contact them.

:Microsoft may collect data about your location, which can be either precise or imprecise. Precise location data can be Global Position System (GPS) data, as well as data identifying nearby cell towers and Wi-Fi hotspots, we collect when you enable location-based products or features. Imprecise location data includes, for example, a location derived from your IP address or data that indicates where you are located with less precision, such as at a city or postal code level.

When you register with us you will complete forms on the Platform and provide personal data about you, such as your name, date of birth, email address, postal address, telephone number, profile photo, and healthcare number.

You can update your medical record on the Platform with your medical data. Once one of our doctors has confirmed these with you in an appointment, they will become a permanent part of your medical record.

We also validate your identity with the information you supply and where you also provide a copy of your identity documentation. Identity verification is carried out by our digital verification partner(s) or our in-house patient experience team, who are subject to a duty of confidentiality.

Data from your activity on the Platform will be collected where we have your consent to do so, including your IP address, location (based on IP address), login information, operating system, device model, version, time zone, browser, language and mobile phone carrier.
Following phlebotomy, cardiology and imaging diagnostic tests, your results will be stored, and a medical report will be prepared by a DCA specialist.

We also use 'cookies'. Cookies are files saved on your devices such as computer, phone or tablet when you visit a website. They collect information about how you use the website and the pages you visit.

Your log in details and password are stored securely. You are responsible for maintaining your password to protect your account and we advise you to make use of security controls which are available to you.
You are under no obligation to share your medical data with us, however, should you choose to withhold requested information, we may not be able to provide you with certain services.

When you visit Vezeeta, we automatically collect certain information about your device, including information about your web browser, IP address, time zone, and some of the cookies that are installed on your device.

We also collect information from you when you register on Vezeeta’s Website, book a doctor’s appointment or subscribe to our newsletter. When booking or registering on our Website, as appropriate, you may be asked to enter your name, e-mail address, mailing address, phone number, and date of birth (“Personal Information”).

Additionally, as you browse the Site, we collect information about the individual web pages or doctors that you view, what websites or search terms referred you to Vezeeta, and information about how you interact with Vezeeta.
We use some of the information we collect to help us screen for potential risk and fraud (in particular, your IP address), and more generally to improve and optimize Vezeeta.

We use the Personal Information that we collect generally to fulfill any bookings made through Vezeeta, to communicate with you, screen for potential risk or fraud; and when in line with the preferences you have shared with us, provide you with information or advertising relating to our products or services.

We scan our website and application regularly for security holes and vulnerabilities to ensure your visit to our site is as a secure as possible. We protect our website through a Web Application Firewall, which filters and monitors the traffic between a web-application and the internet. It detects and blocks common application layer vulnerabilities at the network edge.

We are processing basic data (i.e. name, address and further contact data), contractual data (i.e. payment information, services received and/or used) for the fulfillment of the contractual obligations and services in accordance with art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR as well as for the fulfillment of a legal obligation to which we are subject, pursuant to art. 6 para. 1 lit. c GDPR in conjunction with commercial, trade or tax law, insofar as we are obliged to record and store your data.

During the registration and each time the user logs in and uses the online service, we save the IP address as well as the timestamp of the respective user action. The storage is done due on the basis of our legitimate interests and the interest of the user to be protected from misuse and unauthorized usage in accordance with art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR.

We are dedicated to guarding the security of your information. We use several industry-standard security technologies and procedures devised to help protect your data from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.

HSBC UK Bank plc. (‘HSBC UK’, ‘we’, ‘our’ and ‘us’) collects, uses and shares information about you so that we can provide you with a bank account and related services.
Location: Allows us to detect your location and prevent fraud when you’re using the HSBC UK Mobile Banking app.
Contact details: Allows you to make transactions to your saved contacts.

We may share your information with other HSBC group companies and any sub-contractors, agents or service providers who work for us or other HSBC group companies (including their employees, sub-contractors, service providers, directors and officers) to provide you with products or services that you ask for (such as bank accounts and payments).
Microphone: Allows you to send recorded voice messages when you’re chatting with us.
Device information and internet access: Allows us check if you have a working internet connection.

Application information: Allows us to collect information about applications installed on your device to check whether you might have risky applications on it. This helps us protect you and us from financial crime.

We use the following tools to collect information about your device and the way you use it online. Transmit Security - Helps make sure your logon and authentication are more secure. When you use the Muslim Pro app for Prayer Times, Qibla, Halal Places or Mosque finder, they need to know where you are (i.e. latitude, longitude and altitude as communicated by your device) and the city that you have manually selected. If you have an account with them, your latest location information will be synchronised across all devices associated with your account and will be transmitted to their servers.
Your contact details (i.e. phone number and email address) are collected and processed when you have a Muslim Pro account.

Your online browsing behaviour, preferences and any modifications you make to any of your settings and user activity (i.e searches of the Qur’an or the bookmarked Qur’an verses, prayer requests you post or have indicated to have prayed for, shows you have watched on Qalbox and any other activity on the Services) are collected and processed.

Your personal details which you upload to or enter on the Muslim Pro app (i.e. name, birthdate, gender, and profile information) and your account login details (i.e. username and password) (encrypted) are collected and processed.
As mentioned above, your location data is collected for various features of the app.

Devices you have used to access their Services (i.e. IP address, app/ device identifier, advertising industry standard unique identifier and a “once per app installation” ID (which they generate when you install the Muslim Pro app and which is then destroyed when the Muslim Pro app is deleted from your device)) are collected and processed.
As mentioned above, your location data is collected for various features of the app.

Information on how you use their Services (i.e. title selections, pages you view, shows you have watched, your list of favourites, searches you make and content consumption history), where you are subscribing from (i.e. city, country, time zone, language, membership status), details of your interactions with their customer service (i.e. date, time and reason for contacting them, transcripts of any chat conversations and other recordings), and details of your interactions with their emails, messages through push and online messaging channels are collected and processed.

The technical information about your device (i.e. manufacturer, model, operating system and version), the Muslim Pro app information (Muslim Pro app pairing with a smart watch, date of Muslim Pro app installation, date of last use, versions, setting configurations and software, session duration, feature usage information, browser information) mobile information (i.e. mobile network configuration, name and country of mobile operator) are collected and processed.

Such technical information does not identify a specific person.

Identifiers are collected for the purpose of checking tickets, handling objects found on the networks, managing and maintaining infrastructure in operational conditions, managing security on the networks, and reporting any event threatening security to the police.

Other data is collected for the purpose of managing and improving customer relations, particularly remotely and through statistical monitoring of the use of mobile applications intended for customers. If you use TfL Go and have given permission, TfL will access your location data (e.g., latitude and longitude) to deliver some of the app features. The location data is provided by Apple’s Location Services or Google’s Location Services (depending on your device's operating system). If you use the TfL Journey Planner in this app, TfL will collect the “from” and “to” location (latitude and longitude) in your searches, including your current location if planning a journey from there.

Where you have given permission, the app displays your previous search history under both the 'where to' function and the journey planner. You can change your permission at any point in the app settings. You can also select an option to clear this below any search history displayed or swipe left on individual queries to clear. Your full history can also be cleared within the app settings.

If you have given consent, TfL will use analytics (a similar technology to cookies) to capture information about your use of the app (we call this “usage data”), including Device type, model and Operating system, Unique ID - pseudonymised from the device ID / MAC address, but providing the ability to track usage on a specific device over time, Session information - number (count of visits), duration, time/date, location (mapped to a region, for example, London Borough), When and where accessed (this is based on IP address and is not taken from device GPS data), Screens viewed and interaction on screens, for example, zooming and panning on the map, App interaction - including stations tapped on and stations entered into the ‘to’ and ‘from’ fields in Journey Planner, interaction with 'promoted places' (including links clicked on and journeys planned), Behaviour flows (journeys through the app - for example, where someone exits), Number and type of widgets installed, App crashes. TfL does not use this usage data to identify you, but it provides them with the ability to see usage on a specific device over time.

The 3 word address locations you searched or landed on are collected. This is done to provide the service you are expecting (the conversion of 3 word address to coordinates or vice versa), and to improve the services provided over the longer-term by understanding how users interact with their services.

The 3 word address locations you searched or landed on, including anything you type incorrectly into the search bar, are collected. Your device ID is collected when you visit the website or use the apps. This is done to ensure that content from the website or apps is presented in the most effective manner for you and for your device.

Data such as the type of browser, device and operating system that you are using, referrer information, time zone, user preferences, which pages you visited/actions you carried out on the website and apps and the relevant dates and times, and aggregate statistical information relating to how you and others interact with the website and apps are collected. This is done to provide the service you are expecting, to ensure that content from the website or apps is presented in the most effective manner for you and for your device, and to improve the services provided over the longer-term by understanding how users interact with their services.

Any information that allows us to determine or approximate your location. We may be able to determine your general location based on the IP address you use to access our services. We also collect your search data, including the latitude and longitude of any location-based search you perform either intentionally or via the automatic search of your current location that is performed when you open our applications.
Any information that can be used to communicate with you, including, but not limited to, your name, email address, and other contact details you provide, such as your phone number and address.

Any information you provide to us when interacting with our community, including, but not limited to, any content you post publicly when you use the public features of our services, such as when you participate in the discussion forums or when you write a note to another user on their cache page.

Any information related to your mobile phone or GPS device, including, but not limited to, the unique identifier for your device, such as UUIDs, mobile ad IDs, Apple and Android IDs, analytics app instance IDs, and install IDs, your device type, device specifications, and crash data, including crash traces and breakpad minidump formatted data, your IP network state (online/offline), which version of our applications you’re using, the name of the application you’re using if you’re using an application provided by one of the Authorized Developers, and whether or not you have enabled an Android developer option that enables override of your phone’s GPS coordinates.

Any information on your browsing behavior while using our services, such as your IP address, time and date of access, browsing history, search history, and use of our services, as well as information regarding your interaction with websites, applications, or advertisements when you use our services.

Lyft collects financial information such as bank routing numbers, tax information, and any other payment information provided by the users.
Lyft collects location information (including GPS and WiFi data, IP address, and Bluetooth data) from the users' devices. This information is used to facilitate rides and track their progress.
Lyft collects contact information provided by the users during account registration. This includes the user's name, email address, phone number, and other relevant details.

Lyft collects information about the devices used to access the platform, including device model, IP address, type of browser, version of operating system, identity of carrier and manufacturer, radio type (such as 4G), preferences and settings (such as preferred language), application installations, device identifiers, advertising identifiers, and push notification tokens.

Lyft collects information about the users' use of the platform, including ride information like the date, time, destination, distance, route, payment, and whether a promotional or referral code was used.

Lyft collects other information from the users, such as information related to the identity of the account, documents related to identification (e.g., driver’s license), a profile picture, or “selfie” imagery. If the user chooses to engage in additional offerings on the Lyft Platform (e.g., services for the vehicle or linking to other accounts like travel rewards), they may provide additional information relevant to those offerings.
If the user grants Lyft access to their contact lists, Lyft will access the names and contact information of the people in the user's address book.

If you purchase a product, service, or subscription on the Navionics website or apps or through customer support, then Navionics collects your name, address, email address or other account identifiers, and telephone number. Navionics collects data from users about their usage of their apps, including Chart Installer. The types of analytical information that are collected include the date and time the application accesses their servers, software version, the location of the device, language setting, what information and files have been downloaded to the app, user behavior (e.g., features used, frequency of use), device state information, device model and brand, hardware and operating system information, and information relating to how the app functions.

Navionics uses third parties, such as AppDynamics, to analyze and monitor performance of their complex ecosystem and detect and diagnose errors and issues with response times. To provide these services, these third parties receive basic request information (e.g., IP address).

You may choose to grant Nextdoor permission to access your device’s precise geolocation, which they may use to confirm your address and help operate or personalize their services, including by tagging posts, providing information on or adding information to a map, and helping show you more relevant content or ads.

You may choose to share or sync your contacts with Nextdoor, including contacts’ names, email addresses, physical addresses, phone numbers, or other information included with your contacts. You may also manually enter the contact information of your neighbors. They use the contacts you provide to help you see which of your contacts have already joined Nextdoor, so that you can invite your contacts who aren’t on Nextdoor to join, to be notified when your contacts join, and to see more of what’s relevant to you through personalization.

You may share information about yourself in your profile, including your interests, skills, pictures, information about your household, biographical information (such as your job, hometown, time you have spent living in the area, etc.), emergency contact, or things that you love about your neighborhood. You may post on Nextdoor. Posts may include text, images, photos, videos, tags of people or places, polls, offers to sell or give away items, or anything else you want to share.

This information is collected automatically through technology when you use the Services.

Untitled Stream collects potentially personally-identifying information like Internet Protocol (IP) addresses. Untitled Stream collects non-personally-identifying information of the sort that web browsers and servers typically make available, such as the browser type, language preference, referring site, and the date and time of each visitor request. Untitled Stream’s purpose in collecting non-personally identifying information is to better understand how Untitled Stream’s visitors use its website.
